meanings.definition: To renovate or update the front of a building.
meanings.sent1: The homeowners decided to refronted their old house to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers refronted the office building with new glass panels.
meanings.sent3: After the renovation, the building looked so different that it seemed like it had been refronted by magic.
meanings.sent4: The building's new facade refronted the entire street, making it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors used to refronted the building made it impossible to miss.

meanings.definition: To confront or face something again.
meanings.sent1: She had to refronted her fear of heights when she climbed the ladder for the second time.
meanings.sent2: The detective refronted the suspect with new evidence during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to refronted the vacuum cleaner every time it was turned on, as if it were a new enemy.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the town had to refronted the possibility of flooding once more.
meanings.sent5: The student had to refronted the challenging math problem multiple times before finally solving it.
